revised_title: On the Reflection of X-Rays from Polished Speculum-Metal Mirrors
tldr: This article discusses experiments conducted by Lord Kelvin to investigate the reflection of X-rays from polished speculum-metal mirrors. The author presents evidence that contradicts the general belief that X-rays cannot be reflected and suggests possible explanations for the observed reflection, such as the reflecting surface being rugged for the short wavelength of X-rays or due to phosphorescence or fluorescence in the mirror's substance.
